title: Assessment-Based Instructional Design for Diagnosing and Improving Secondary Algebra Learning Errors

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary arithmetic operations and comprehension of simple equations
context.additional_context: Most Learners Aim for Science-Related Careers and Require Systematic Review of Algebraic Concepts; Personalized Feedback Provided Based on Error Pattern Analysis From Assessment Results

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three common errors occurring during algebraic expression expansion and factoring processes.
Learners can diagnose their own errors in solving given algebraic problems with 80% accuracy using diagnostic assessment tools.
Based on assessment feedback, learners can improve their correct answer rate by over 50% when retrying the same problem type.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
